frame.name: Commutative_process
frame.definition:
<def-root>LUs in this frame describe a commutative operation of arithmetic, e.g. addition and multiplication, involving two numbers, labeled <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen> or, collectively, <fen>Terms</fen>. When referencing the process, the numbers can be vague and are often omitted through indefinite null instantiation. There may also be a <fen>Calculator</fen> who applies the operation.
<ex><t>Add</t> <fex name="Term1">three</fex> <fex name="Term2">to five</fex>.</ex> <ex>Any kid knows <t>addition</t>. <fex name="Terms">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Term1
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically more prominent number involved in a commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Term2
FE.definition: <def-root>The grammatically less prominent number involved in commutative operation.</def-root>

FE.name: Terms
FE.definition: <def-root>Two more or elements of a commutative arithmetic operation. This frame element may be represented as <fen>Term1</fen> and <fen>Term2</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Calculator
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity that uses the arithmetic operation.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: multiply.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: scale a number by another number

lexUnit.name: addition.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of combining two numbers

lexUnit.name: multiplication.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of scaling one number by another number
